info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:31AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Swain and northeastern Graham Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1231 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Robbinsville, or near Fontana Lake, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryson City, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Wesser, Stecoah, Whittier and Luada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
